alert.note: Alert for Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 2:34PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN STONE COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 234 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 6 miles west of Perkinston, or 10 miles southwest of Wiggins, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McHenry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
